alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 10 at 2:03PM CDT until June 10 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT/515 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN CHERRY COUNTY... At 103 PM MDT /203 PM CDT/, Thunderstorms produced between 3 and 4 inches of rain this morning and runoff is starting to diminish. However, hazardous conditions will linger for another hour or two. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Cherry County This includes the following highways... Highway 12 between mile markers 6 and 7. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
